descript.abstract: Canada Major Roads is a line theme representing the major roads of Canada. These include interstates, inter-metropolitan area, and intra-state highways and major roads.
descript.purpose: Canada Major Roads provides a subset of highways and roads for national and provincial display.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:100,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The positional accuracy matches or is better than the positional accuracy of the Census TIGER/Line coordinates. The positional accuracy of the TIGER/Line coordinates at best is +/- 167 feet.

citeinfo.title: Tele Atlas StreetMap Premium for ArcGIS v. 9.0

serinfo.sername: Tele Atlas StreetMap Premium for ArcGIS

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted the data set from Tele Atlas StreetMap Premium for ArcGIS v. 9.0. Exported the data set to a shapefile. Added the MILES attribute and calculated its values. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.
EDS staff clipped out the Canadian features and exported the result to the geopackage format

enttyp.enttypd: The lines represent the major roads of the United States and Canada.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Prefix directions of the address attributes for the features.

attr.attrdef: Prefix type is a standard ESRI address component used for prefix types. It is a result of address standardization.

attrdomv.udom: Prefix street types of the address attributes for the features.

attr.attrdef: The name of the major road. Where a highway segment has more than one name, the higher-level name will be used, and always in this order: interstates, then U.S. highways and then state highways.
The suffix street type. A street designator or type refers to the portion of a road name that is called "ST," "AVE," "PL," etc.

attrdomv.udom: Suffix street types of the address attributes for the features.
Suffix directions of the address attributes for the features.

attr.attrdef: The Arterial Classification Code. This is the Tele Atlas system for categorizing roads according to the level of travel mobility that they provide in the road network. Mobility refers to the volume of traffic that a stretch of road carries and the length of trip that it serves.
The shield represents the name based on its Primary Major Road Name.

edom.edomvd: Interstate - Business Loop or Business Route
U.S. Highway - Business Loop or Business Route
State Highway - Business Loop or Business Route

attr.attrdef: The HWY_NUM field indicates the number that appears in the shield for that highway. This will be present only for interstates, U.S. highways, state highways, the Trans-Canada Highway, and Autoroutes. The HWY_NUM field will be populated only on FCC segments of A1*, A2* and A3*.
Length of major road line segment in miles.
